content:
• Tuesday, November 13, 2012
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT) -3.4% AH after disclosing CFO John Ritchie is leaving at year's...

    Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT) -3.4% AH after disclosing CFO John Ritchie is leaving at year's end to "pursue other opportunities." A search has begun for a successor. Ubiquiti's accounting has been criticized in the past. (FQ1 results/guidance: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM
  • RENN

    Renren (NYSE:RENN): Q3 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $50.4M (+47.2% Y/Y) in-line....

    Renren (NYSE:RENN): Q3 EPS of -$0.01 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $50.4M (+47.2% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • FOLD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FOLD +6.7%. CSCO +6.6%. WWD +3.3%. ARUN +3.3%. NTI...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FOLD +6.7%. CSCO +6.6%. WWD +3.3%. ARUN +3.3%. NTI +2.8%.
    After-hours top losers: MOS -5.4%. SEP -4.6%. ES-OLD -4.0%. UBNT -3.4%. PATK -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • JNPR

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) +2.5% AH and F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) +1.4% after Cisco beats FQ4 estimates,...

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) +2.5% AH and F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) +1.4% after Cisco beats FQ4 estimates, provides decent FQ1 guidance, and delivers relatively upbeat earnings call commentary about U.S. and Asia-Pac demand (though not Europe), particularly regarding service provider activity. Some other names to keep an eye on tomorrow: RVBD, CIEN, JDSU, FNSR, TLAB, ALU, AMCC, ADTN.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • CSCO

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) uses its FQ1 call (webcast) to guide for FQ2 revenue growth of 3.5%-5.5% and...

    Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) uses its FQ1 call (webcast) to guide for FQ2 revenue growth of 3.5%-5.5% and EPS of $0.47-$0.48, which compares with a consensus of 4.2% growth and $0.47. Gross margin is expected to be in the range of 61%-62%, down a bit from FQ1's 62.7%. Shares +7.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • AMD

    So much for that. AMD -2.9% AH after stating it isn't planning either a sale of the company or a...

    So much for that. AMD -2.9% AH after stating it isn't planning either a sale of the company or a significant sale of assets. But the company didn't deny having hired JPMorgan to explore options. (previous: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 6 Comments
  • MOS

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) -4.8% AH after lowering its FQ2 volume guidance for potash and phosphate on...

    Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) -4.8% AH after lowering its FQ2 volume guidance for potash and phosphate on weaker shipments in the export market. MOS says international crop nutrient market demand has weakened since earlier guidance, primarily as a result of distributors delaying purchases to avoid price risk; sales volumes may not pick up until calendar 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +5.5%) soars on a report it has hired JPMorgan to explore strategic options. The...

    AMD (AMD +5.5%) soars on a report it has hired JPMorgan to explore strategic options. The struggling chipmaker has frequently been the subject of M&A rumors, but many are skeptical a third party will be interested in acquiring its CPU business, in light of Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) historical advantages in resources and scale. AMD does, however, have a sizable patent portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • WFT

    Weatherford (WFT -16.2%) pledges to sharpen its focus on higher quality growth, taking a more...

    Weatherford (WFT -16.2%) pledges to sharpen its focus on higher quality growth, taking a more selective approach to expansion after more than a year of tending to tax problems, CEO Bernard Duroc-Danner says during its Q3 conference call: "Do we need to be emphasizing as many product lines as we do with the same degree of both people and capital support? The answer to that question is no."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • SVM

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM -3.5%) slips following a negative article by short seller Alfred Little...

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM -3.5%) slips following a negative article by short seller Alfred Little focusing last week's resignation of exec Lorne Waldman. Little suspects Waldman resigned "because he is an honest, well-intentioned individual who could no longer tolerate Rui Feng’s completely unjustifiable quest for revenge... [he] wisely abandoned a sinking ship."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 3 Comments
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum (CPE -5.8%) is downgraded to Accumulate from Buy with a $6 price target (down...

    Callon Petroleum (CPE -5.8%) is downgraded to Accumulate from Buy with a $6 price target (down from $8) at Global Hunter, citing CPE's need to address its liquidity situation. After Q3's hurricane downtime, CPE is left with just $36M on the revolver and an expected $19M outspend in Q4. The market despises uncertainty, and the firm thinks this will hurt CPE's short-term performance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • NS

    NuStar Energy (NS +5.8%) is upgraded to Neutral from Underperform at Credit Suisse, which says...

    NuStar Energy (NS +5.8%) is upgraded to Neutral from Underperform at Credit Suisse, which says its concerns regarding the sustainability of NS' distribution are now reflected in the unit price. The firm thinks units are fairly valued based upon the cash flow power of NS' underlying fee-based pipeline and storage assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • CHK

    Hedge fund manager Mohnish Pabrai nearly tripled his holdings of Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.5%)...

    Hedge fund manager Mohnish Pabrai nearly tripled his holdings of Chesapeake Energy (CHK +1.5%) during Q3 and now owns nearly 3M shares of the embattled company. His purchase prices were in the $16.83-$20.52 range, with an estimated average price of $19.08.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 5 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -3.7%) will begin selling its first BlackBerry 10 smartphones on...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -3.7%) will begin selling its first BlackBerry 10 smartphones on multiple continents within 30 days of the company's Jan. 30 launch event, says COO Kristian Tear. Some analysts had been expecting a March debut. Details are still pending on which carriers will initially support the phones, and if any will have exclusivity deals. The rumored L-series is likely to be among the first devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 5 Comments
  • LGND

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +6.9%) gains today after reporting positive results from...

    Ligand Pharmaceuticals (LGND +6.9%) gains today after reporting positive results from preclinical studies using its HepDirect liver-targeting technology platform for the treatment of hepatitis C. According to the data, LGND's HepDirect prodrug of 2'-C methylguanosine, LG-7501, may be effective in improving the effectiveness of hep C treatment while reducing systemic side effects.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • BIG

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG -3%) trip up after Deutsche Bank tags the company with an intraday...

    Shares of Big Lots (BIG -3%) trip up after Deutsche Bank tags the company with an intraday downgrade to Sell from Hold and a lowered price target of $23. Earlier this week, JPMorgan also took a negative stance on the embattled retailer.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • MATN

    Shares of OxiGene (OXGN +31%) are soaring today after the company released results from its...

    Shares of OxiGene (OXGN +31%) are soaring today after the company released results from its Phase 2 trial of Zybrestat, a potential treatment for patients with polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy, a degenerative eye disease with features similar to age-related macular degeneration. The data was presented today at the annual meeting of the American Academy of Ophthalmology.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMMR

    Haptic feedback tech provider Immersion (IMMR +9.4%) is now up 22% over the last two days in the...

    Haptic feedback tech provider Immersion (IMMR +9.4%) is now up 22% over the last two days in the absence of major news - shares have rallied strongly in the past on account of rumors. Last week, SA's Paolo Gorgo highlighted Immersion's growing Chinese presence, fueled by a partnership with upstart Android vendor Xiaomi, but also criticized its execution in turning discussions into deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy's (CLNE +10.6%) partnership with GE to build two liquefied natural gas plants won't...

    Clean Energy's (CLNE +10.6%) partnership with GE to build two liquefied natural gas plants won't have an immediate impact on CLNE’s volumes, but "taking action to ensure a stable LNG supply is important to the long-term adoption of LNG fueling" in the U.S., Simmons analysts say in supporting the deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NSPH +3.5%) moves higher today after the FDA granted 510(k) clearance for the...

    Nanosphere (NSPH +3.5%) moves higher today after the FDA granted 510(k) clearance for the marketing of its CYP2C19 Nucleic Acid Test on the automated sample-to-result Verigene System. The test is used as an aid for clinicians to determine therapeutic strategy for drugs metabolized by the CYP450 2C19 genetic pathway by identifying variations directly from a patient's whole blood sample in less than 2.5 hours.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • SOHU

    Sohu (SOHU -3.2%) is off after HSBC starts coverage with an Underweight and $37 PT. Shares of...

    Sohu (SOHU -3.2%) is off after HSBC starts coverage with an Underweight and $37 PT. Shares of the Chinese search/portal/gaming firm have been pressured this year by concerns about the impact of its aggressive search R&D spending on its bottom line.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • WFT

    The knives are out for Weatherford (WFT -13.7%) after the energy services company posted a weak...

    The knives are out for Weatherford (WFT -13.7%) after the energy services company posted a weak Q3 and warned of further accounting discrepancies in previous quarters that likely will lead to a "growing sense of unease and alarm," Simmons & Co. writes. Barclays cuts its rating and says it has "less confidence that a turnaround is achievable in the next two quarters."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM | 1 Comment
  • QRVO

    TriQuint (TQNT +1.7%) has spiked higher on news director/Mentor Graphics CEO Walden C. Rhines...

    TriQuint (TQNT +1.7%) has spiked higher on news director/Mentor Graphics CEO Walden C. Rhines bought 100K shares on Friday at or near a price of $4.70. TriQuint was crushed last month due to the soft EPS guidance provided with its Q3 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • MRVL

    Marvell (MRVL -1.7%) is trading lower after UBS slashed its estimates through 2014, citing...

    Marvell (MRVL -1.7%) is trading lower after UBS slashed its estimates through 2014, citing storage and wireless softness. Marvell's shares have been hit hard as weak PC demand takes a toll on hard drive controller sales, and the company bleeds share in China's TD-SCDMA baseband  chip market. FQ3 results arrive on Thursday. (FQ3 warning/CFO departure)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNOM

    Shares of Complete Genomics (GNOM +3.3%) are up today on a report that it received an...

    Shares of Complete Genomics (GNOM +3.3%) are up today on a report that it received an unsolicited $3.30 per share bid from "Party H" on November 5th. The offer follows an earlier tender offer from BGI-Shenzhen last month. Complete Genomics told Party H the bid didn't "constitute a superior proposal" and would likely not gain anti-trust clearance.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +30%) is soaring today after the company reported Q3 earnings of $0.88...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT +30%) is soaring today after the company reported Q3 earnings of $0.88 per share,  blowing away the prior-year period's $0.46. Revenues were $17.3M, up 48.5% from $11.7M in the same period last year. No analyst estimates were available for comparison. Net income growth jumped 107.5%, driven by a sharp improvement in demand for its next generation of dyeing machines as well as solid growth in its forged products for non-wind applications.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +4.8%) trades higher after CEO William Lynch issues a positive outlook for...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +4.8%) trades higher after CEO William Lynch issues a positive outlook for the company. The exec's counter to the death of its brick and mortar store argument is the retail bookstore chain is gaining market share and growing profits. On Nook products, Lynch notes the strong pre-order demand and tips the company to see a strong holiday season. Is B&N undervalued? Lynch points to EBITDA growth and highlights the pending Microsoft deal as a value proposition. (Bloomberg interview)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • ZAZA

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA +27%) rips higher after reporting Q3 earnings of $1.02/share vs. a loss of...

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA +27%) rips higher after reporting Q3 earnings of $1.02/share vs. a loss of $0.03/share in the same period last year; revenues popped to $207M vs, $4.4M in the year-ago quarter. Total production was 101K barrels, up from 8,442 Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM

  • A big turnaround in Europe over the past hour is leading U.S. shares higher (or is it the other...

    A big turnaround in Europe over the past hour is leading U.S. shares higher (or is it the other way around). The Stoxx 50 +0.9%, led by Spain +1.7% on faint recycling of rumors about Madrid finally making its bailout request. Threatening 6% earlier, the Spanish 10-year yield is now down 4 bps to 5.85%. The S&P 500 +0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 3 Comments
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -3.1%) is closing in on its 52-week low after a Taiwanese paper reports CEO Robin Li...

    Baidu (BIDU -3.1%) is closing in on its 52-week low after a Taiwanese paper reports CEO Robin Li is experiencing "a growing sense of crisis" over the company's recent challenges (search competition from Qihoo and a shift in traffic towards mobile devices). Also, a Shanghai paper claims Baidu's recent launch of an Android web browser (crucial to Baidu's efforts to gain mobile search share) hasn't met expectations - might that drive Baidu to acquire market leader UCWeb?
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • CSOD

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +10.6%) is rallying strongly post-earnings for the third time in a...

    Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +10.6%) is rallying strongly post-earnings for the third time in a row. Though results were mixed, bookings rose 78% Y/Y to $42.7M, easily surpassing revenue growth of 54%, and the company's deferred revenue balance rose 20% Q/Q to $72.6M. 124 clients were added, raising the total to 1,100+. Cornerstone now expects 2012 revenue of $117M-$118M and EPS of -$0.31 to -$0.35 vs. a consensus of $116.9M and -$0.28. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • SLS

    Shares of Galena Biopharma (GALE +12.9%) are on a tear this morning after reporting a better...

    Shares of Galena Biopharma (GALE +12.9%) are on a tear this morning after reporting a better than anticipated Q3 loss of $0.09 per share, narrower than the prior year's EPS loss of $0.13 and beating the Street consensus for a loss of $0.10. Operating losses decreased Y/Y, largely due to writedown's taken during Q311 due to discontinued operations, which were driven by the company's ongoing, late-stage trial for NeuVax and the spin-off of a pharmaceuticals subsidiary.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • SSYS

    Stratasys (SSYS +1.1%) is ticking higher after receiving an upgrade to Overweight from Piper,...

    Stratasys (SSYS +1.1%) is ticking higher after receiving an upgrade to Overweight from Piper, which cites strong secular growth for the 3D printer market. Rival 3D Systems (DDD -4.1%) caught a similar upgrade, but is selling off again after its accounting and acquisition history were criticized yesterday by SA's Douglas W. House.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • ALNY

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +4.8%) is higher this morning after reaching a settlement with...

    Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +4.8%) is higher this morning after reaching a settlement with Tekmira Pharmaceuticals (TKMR +19.3%) resolving all litigation issues between the companies. It also signed a new licensing agreement that restructures the relationship and provides clarity on all intellectual property and licensing issues. As a result, TKMR will receive $65M within 10 days and is eligible to receive an additional $10M in near-term milestone payments in 2013. (Conference Call Webcast Replay)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP -2.2%) moves lower again after Morgan Stanley downgrades shares to Equal Weight...

    Molycorp (MCP -2.2%) moves lower again after Morgan Stanley downgrades shares to Equal Weight following Friday's disclosure of a formal order of SEC investigation. While it's possible the worst case scenario already is priced in, the firm says uncertainty surrounding the issue and the possibility that it will take some time to resolve leads to the downgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 6 Comments
  • LF

    LeapFrog (LF -0.2%) jumps higher with some insider buying helping to tip sentiment. Though the...

    LeapFrog (LF -0.2%) jumps higher with some insider buying helping to tip sentiment. Though the purchases weren't for earth-shattering amounts, any sign of support from execs in Q4 is positive with the company highly dependent upon the success of new products during the holiday selling season.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +4.1%) is up after Craig-Hallum upgrades shares all the way to Buy from Sell, and...

    Fusion-io (FIO +4.1%) is up after Craig-Hallum upgrades shares all the way to Buy from Sell, and sets a $32 PT. Shares remain well off their early-October highs following the disappointing guidance that accompanied Fusion-io's FQ1 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (HK +9.1%) surges in early trading after a slew of insider buys is disclosed;...

    Halcon Resources (HK +9.1%) surges in early trading after a slew of insider buys is disclosed; in all, the company's CEO, four VPs and two directors bought a total of 254K shares at $5.35-$5.78 between Nov. 9-12 worth ~$1.5M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW +1.1%) is outperforming after introducing the VM-Series, a next-gen...

    Palo Alto Networks (PANW +1.1%) is outperforming after introducing the VM-Series, a next-gen firewall that can run on servers using VMware's (NYSE:VMW) virtualization software. The allows the firewall (and its policies) to be quickly moved from server to server. Palo Alto also introduced new mid-range hardware, a malware prevention service, and an update to the OS its firewalls run on. Gartner notes Check Point (NASDAQ:CHKP) has long offered a virtual firewall, but expects the VMware partnership to give Palo Alto, whose solutions are differentiated in other respects, a lift. (Citrix partnership)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • PBY-OLD

    Auto supply stocks are beating sluggish market benchmarks, getting a lift from a report that...

    Auto supply stocks are beating sluggish market benchmarks, getting a lift from a report that tips off Advance Auto Parts as a potential P-E target. The sector has also been bandied around as a potential beneficiary of a fiscal cliff stalemate if consumers opt to fix their current cars this month instead of pulling the trigger on a new buy. Gainers: PBY-OLD +0.5%, ORLY +1.6%, AZO +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • DDC

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD -2.1%) agrees to buy BHP Billiton’s (BHP -1.2%) diamonds...

    Harry Winston Diamond (HWD -2.1%) agrees to buy BHP Billiton’s (BHP -1.2%) diamonds business for $500M, as BHP elects to get out of the diamond business because it could not build up enough scale to make it worthwhile. The deal includes BHP’s 80% stake in the rich Ekati diamond mine in the Northwest Territories, along with its diamond marketing business.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • AAP

    Share of Advance Auto Parts (AAP +2.3%) come out of the gate strong after Bloomberg reports...

    Share of Advance Auto Parts (AAP +2.3%) come out of the gate strong after Bloomberg reports several P-E firms are taking a look at the company. The retailer is consider attractive, despite its less-than-stellar recent results, in part due to a general trend of consumers to hold on to their vehicles longer.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • PTR

    PetroChina (PTR -2%) is losing support from analysts who say earnings growth at Asia's biggest...

    PetroChina (PTR -2%) is losing support from analysts who say earnings growth at Asia's biggest oil producer is stunted by its unprofitable natural gas imports, Bloomberg reports. PTR must double gas imports over the next three years and continue selling at a loss if state-price controls remain, Bernstein analysts say.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • DMND

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +5.7%) rally after the company merely announces plans to finally...

    Shares of Diamond Foods (DMND +5.7%) rally after the company merely announces plans to finally release its restated results for FY10-FY12 tomorrow. The heavily-shorted stock could see a period of high volatility as the holding pattern finally ends.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • JAGGF

    Jaguar Mining (NYSE:JAG) -8.9% premarket after reporting a net Q3 EPS loss of $0.26 vs. a net...

    Jaguar Mining (NYSE:JAG) -8.9% premarket after reporting a net Q3 EPS loss of $0.26 vs. a net EPS loss of $0.61 in the year-ago quarter. JAG revises its outlook for 2012 production and cash operating costs, seeing gold production of 100K-110K oz. with operating costs of $1,050-$1,150/oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 2 Comments

  • Market preview: It's all very red on both sides of the Atlantic as the ongoing sagas of Greece...

    Market preview: It's all very red on both sides of the Atlantic as the ongoing sagas of Greece and the fiscal cliff weigh on sentiment in the absence of anything else to grab investor attention. S&P benchmark futures are -0.6%. Home Depot is +2.1% following earnings, although Vodafone is -3.5%, while Xerox is +2.05% despite cutting guidance again. Maybe it's the 35% dividend hike that's doing it. Later: Treasury budget
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • FFIV

    F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) +1.9% on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm thinks FY13 product revenue...

    F5 (NASDAQ:FFIV) +1.9% on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm thinks FY13 product revenue growth can exceed consensus by 7% thanks to an application delivery controller product refresh, security software module sales, and share gains stemming from Cisco's exit from the ADC market. F5 has seen a big selloff since spring on worries about slowing growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NSPH

    Premarket gainers: NSPH +15%. GALE +14%. HZNP +10%. NTI +10%. GBX +8%.Losers: HCLP -15%. AKS...

    Premarket gainers: NSPH +15%. GALE +14%. HZNP +10%. NTI +10%. GBX +8%.
    Losers: HCLP -15%. AKS -12%. NBG -11%. WFT -10%. SPIL -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • WFT

    Weatherford (NYSE:WFT) -9.2% premarket after Q3 results fell short of expectations; WFT also cut...

    Weatherford (NYSE:WFT) -9.2% premarket after Q3 results fell short of expectations; WFT also cut Q4 estimates and said it would be forced to restate some earlier quarters. WFT kitchen-sinked its Q3 by taking several charges, including a $589M non-cash goodwill impairment in the Middle East and Africa and $204M for the non-cash writedown of equity method investments against Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • HCLP

    Hi-Crush Partners (NYSE:HCLP): Q3 EPS of $0.33 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $12.6M misses by $8M....

    Hi-Crush Partners (NYSE:HCLP): Q3 EPS of $0.33 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $12.6M misses by $8M. Shares -4.2% premarket. PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:44 AM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) announces a new $250M share repurchase program after using up all...

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) announces a new $250M share repurchase program after using up all of its previous $500M plan. MNST +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • MSFT

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) -3.8% premarket after the departure of Windows chief and putative heir...

    Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) -3.8% premarket after the departure of Windows chief and putative heir apparent Steven Sinofsky. As to the reason for his exit, the spin room is open. One source tells Owen Thomas, Sinofsky threatened to quit if not given the CEO nod, and Ballmer called his bluff. Maybe not helping are tepid sales of Surface, which reportedly may only reach 60% of company forecasts by year end.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM | 15 Comments
  • AKS

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -6.9% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q4, seeing a loss...

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -6.9% premarket after issuing downside guidance for Q4, seeing a loss of $0.34-$0.39/share vs. -$0.19 consensus. AKS expects shipments of 1.375-1.4M tons in Q4 vs. shipments of 1,363,500 tons in Q3; sees average selling price for all products declining ~5% from Q3 average of $1,073/ton, and does not expect lower selling prices will be fully offset by reduced raw material costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • CPRI

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS) slump 6.1% in premarket trading after the firm's guidance shows a...

    Shares of Michael Kors (KORS) slump 6.1% in premarket trading after the firm's guidance shows a pace of growth below expectations. Analysts had the luxury retailer lined up for FY13 revenue of $1.98B, above the forecast that came in from the company of $1.86B-$1.96B. Notable Calls expects a vigorous defense from bulls, but warns valuation questions are now teed up. Also on watch: Coach (COH), Ralph Lauren (NYSE:RL), PVH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • DKS

    The quick analyst take on Dick's Sporting Goods' (NYSE:DKS) Q3 (I, II) is largely positive as...

    The quick analyst take on Dick's Sporting Goods' (NYSE:DKS) Q3 (I, II) is largely positive as the retailer proves the athletic apparel sector has plenty of room left for growth. The 47% gain in online sales is a "stunner" - especially after J.C. Penney showed online sales can actually go negative - while the company also avoided costly writedowns or any big jump in SG&A expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • XRX

    Xerox (NYSE:XRX) cuts guidance again, expecting Q4 EPS of $0.28-$0.30 vs. consensus of $0.32....

    Xerox (NYSE:XRX) cuts guidance again, expecting Q4 EPS of $0.28-$0.30 vs. consensus of $0.32. FY2013 EPS of $1.09-$1.15 is expected, with flat to +2% revenue growth. The dividend is hiked 35% to an annual $0.23 and the stock repurchase plan is bumped by $1B. CEO Burns says the global economy has weakened further since last month's warning, particularly in the U.S., particularly at the government level. Shares -1.3% premarket. (PR)

    More on Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS): Consolidated same store sales up 5.1% Y/Y - led by a 3.9% gain at Dick's Sporting Goods stores, a 2.3% increase at Golf Galaxy, and a 46.7% rise in the firm's eCommerce business. Added 21 stores during the quarter to take square footage up to 29.2M, +7% Y/Y. Full year EPS guidance set at $2.53-$2.55 after factoring in an estimate for Q4 EPS of $1.03-$1.05. DKS +1.5% premarket. (PR)

    More on Home Depot's (NYSE:HD) Q3: The company showed broadly better-than-expected results for...

    More on Home Depot's (NYSE:HD) Q3: The company showed broadly better-than-expected results for the quarter with the slow housing recovery as a backdrop. No specific breakdown on the impact of Hurricane Sandy on sales is issued. The company's square footage flat was flat for the period. Pacing its growth, the number of transactions increased 1.7% Y/Y while the average ticket size grew up 2.9% to $54.55 - marking the best growth rate for ticket size in four years. Conference call scheduled for 9:00 AM EST (webcast). Shares of HD -0.4% premarket. (PR)
